column5: Been waiting for while to finally get the chance to target and finish this project.... The easiest part of it being cutting the design in the wood, which was done last fall but the next step was the longest.... painting.... 15 sets of them.   Got the first coat of white on, the day before yesterday and applied the color coat yesterday.  Still have to add the eye guides and the reels and a coat of varnish to protect the paint job.  Really small details and really proud of the outcome.   Thought I'd share this with you guys....  took a couple of pics, here they are      Leechman
Looks good, but what is it? LOL!  (I'm guessing tip-up but I wouldn't bet my life on it.)
lmao....I was just thinking the same thing........
Yes Mike tipups and the best there is.... remember this one    Forgot to mention that I had 15 sets to paint.... real long job but what can I say, love doing this
I'll buy 4 @ 25 a pop????  PM me
Once again, they are very well done Jacques.  They are perfectly balanced.
First I thought curling,then shuffle board. HAHA  Very nice work bud.
Amazing really...I can't get over how well balanced those are...c'est magnifique!
Thanks Bruce   LOL thanks Brian   Thanks johnnyb   They certainly have the look.... Thanks SNAG

cant go wrong with the best craftmenship in Cnanada!  i use these perfectly balanced tip-ups every week end.  when something is on your tip..... dont worry youl see the tip-up move.  the slightest tail swipe will make these baby tumble.  works real good for finiky days . when the bite is light.  i love how they are SOOO light!  good job jaques . one day you will be the leading tip-up maker in the WORLD!  selling these right up to russia!  thanx again for the ones you gave me!
